name: app build
description:
This command executes the build script specified in the element's TOML file. You can specify a custom script in the file. To learn about configuration files in Shopify apps, refer to [App configuration](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/configuration).

  If you're building a [theme app extension](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/online-store/theme-app-extensions), then running the `build` command runs [Theme Check](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/theme-check) against your extension to ensure that it's valid.
overviewPreviewDescription: Build the app, including extensions.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app build` command:

appbuild.name: appbuild

members.name: --client-id <value>
members.description: Application's Client ID that will be exposed at build time.

members.name: -c, --config <value>
members.description: The name of the app configuration.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: --skip-dependencies-installation
members.description: Skips the installation of dependencies. Deprecated, use workspaces instead.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: app config link
description:
Pulls app configuration from the Partner Dashboard and creates or overwrites a configuration file. You can create a new app with this command to start with a default configuration file.

  For more information on the format of the created TOML configuration file, refer to the [App configuration](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/configuration) page.
overviewPreviewDescription: Fetch your app configuration from the Partner Dashboard.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app config link` command:

appconfiglink.name: appconfiglink

members.name: --client-id <value>
members.description: The Client ID of your app.

members.name: -c, --config <value>
members.description: The name of the app configuration.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: app config use
description: Sets default configuration when you run app-related CLI commands. If you omit the `config-name` parameter, then you'll be prompted to choose from the configuration files in your project.
overviewPreviewDescription: Activate an app configuration.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app config use` command:

appconfiguse.name: appconfiguse

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: --reset
members.description: Reset current configuration.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: app deploy
description:
[Builds the app](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/commands#build), then deploys your app configuration and extensions.

  This command creates an app version, which is a snapshot of your app configuration and all extensions, including the app extensions that you manage in the Partner Dashboard. This version is then released to users.

  This command doesn't deploy your [web app](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/structure#web-components). You need to [deploy your web app](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/deployment/web) to your own hosting solution.
overviewPreviewDescription: Deploy your Shopify app.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app deploy` command:

appdeploy.name: appdeploy

members.name: --client-id <value>
members.description: The Client ID of your app.

members.name: -c, --config <value>
members.description: The name of the app configuration.

members.name: -f, --force
members.description: Deploy without asking for confirmation.

members.name: --message <value>
members.description: Optional message that will be associated with this version. This is for internal use only and won't be available externally.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --no-release
members.description: Creates a version but doesn't release it - it's not made available to merchants.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: --reset
members.description: Reset all your settings.

members.name: --source-control-url <value>
members.description: URL associated with the new app version.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

members.name: --version <value>
members.description: Optional version tag that will be associated with this app version. If not provided, an auto-generated identifier will be generated for this app version.

appdeploy.value:
export interface appdeploy {
  /**
   * The Client ID of your app.
   */
  '--client-id <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The name of the app configuration.
   */
  '-c, --config <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Deploy without asking for confirmation.
   */
  '-f, --force'?: ''

  /**
   * Optional message that will be associated with this version. This is for internal use only and won't be available externally.
   */
  '--message <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Creates a version but doesn't release it - it's not made available to merchants.
   */
  '--no-release'?: ''

  /**
   * The path to your app directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Reset all your settings.
   */
  '--reset'?: ''

  /**
   * URL associated with the new app version.
   */
  '--source-control-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * Optional version tag that will be associated with this app version. If not provided, an auto-generated identifier will be generated for this app version.
   */
  '--version <value>'?: string
}

name: app dev
description:
[Builds the app](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/commands#build) and lets you preview it on a [development store](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/development-stores) or [Plus sandbox store](https://help.shopify.com/partners/dashboard/managing-stores/plus-sandbox-store?shpxid=09640797-900B-4D1E-6E65-76A35B54FF4A).

  To preview your app on a development store or Plus sandbox store, Shopify CLI walks you through the following steps. If you've run `dev` before, then your settings are saved and some of these steps are skipped. You can reset these configurations using `dev --reset` to go through all of them again:

- Associating your project with an app associated with your Partner account or organization, or creating a new app.
- Selecting a development store or Plus sandbox store to use for testing. If you have only one store, then it's selected automatically.
- Installing your app on the store using the provided install link.
- Creating a tunnel between your local environment and the store using Cloudflare.

  You can use your own tunneling software instead, by passing your tunnel URL with the `--tunnel-url` flag.
- Updating the app URLs that are set in the Partner Dashboard.

  To avoid overwriting any URLs that are already set, select the No, never option. If you select this option, then you're provided with URLs that you can manually add in the Partner Dashboard so you can preview your app.

- Enabling development store preview for extensions.
- Serving [GraphiQL for the Admin API](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/graphiql-admin-api#use-a-local-graphiql-instance) using your app's credentials and access scopes.
- Building and serving your app and app extensions.

If you're using the PHP or Ruby app template, then you need to complete the following steps before you can preview your app for the first time:

- PHP: [Set up your Laravel app](https://github.com/Shopify/shopify-app-template-php#setting-up-your-laravel-app)
- Ruby: [Set up your Rails app](https://github.com/Shopify/shopify-app-template-ruby#setting-up-your-rails-app)

> Caution: To use a development store or Plus sandbox store with Shopify CLI, you need to be the store owner, or have a [staff account](https://help.shopify.com/manual/your-account/staff-accounts?shpxid=09640797-900B-4D1E-6E65-76A35B54FF4A) on the store. Staff accounts are created automatically the first time you access a development store with your Partner staff account through the Partner Dashboard.
overviewPreviewDescription: Run the app.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app dev` command:

appdev.name: appdev

members.name: --checkout-cart-url <value>
members.description: Resource URL for checkout UI extension. Format: "/cart/{productVariantID}:{productQuantity}"

members.name: --client-id <value>
members.description: The Client ID of your app.

members.name: -c, --config <value>
members.description: The name of the app configuration.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --no-update
members.description: Skips the Partners Dashboard URL update step.

members.name: --notify <value>
members.description: The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: --reset
members.description: Reset all your settings.

members.name: --skip-dependencies-installation
members.description: Skips the installation of dependencies. Deprecated, use workspaces instead.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. Must be an existing development or Shopify Plus sandbox store.

members.name: --subscription-product-url <value>
members.description: Resource URL for subscription UI extension. Format: "/products/{productId}"

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the theme app extension host theme.

members.name: --theme-app-extension-port <value>
members.description: Local port of the theme app extension development server.

members.name: --tunnel-url <value>
members.description: Use a custom tunnel, it must be running before executing dev. Format: "https://my-tunnel-url:port".

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

appdev.value:
export interface appdev {
  /**
   * Resource URL for checkout UI extension. Format: "/cart/{productVariantID}:{productQuantity}"
   */
  '--checkout-cart-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The Client ID of your app.
   */
  '--client-id <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The name of the app configuration.
   */
  '-c, --config <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Skips the Partners Dashboard URL update step.
   */
  '--no-update'?: ''

  /**
   * The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.
   */
  '--notify <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The path to your app directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Reset all your settings.
   */
  '--reset'?: ''

  /**
   * Skips the installation of dependencies. Deprecated, use workspaces instead.
   */
  '--skip-dependencies-installation'?: ''

  /**
   * Store URL. Must be an existing development or Shopify Plus sandbox store.
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Resource URL for subscription UI extension. Format: "/products/{productId}"
   */
  '--subscription-product-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the theme app extension host theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Local port of the theme app extension development server.
   */
  '--theme-app-extension-port <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Use a custom tunnel, it must be running before executing dev. Format: "https://my-tunnel-url:port".
   */
  '--tunnel-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: app env pull
description:
Creates or updates an `.env` files that contains app and app extension environment variables.

  When an existing `.env` file is updated, changes to the variables are displayed in the terminal output. Existing variables and commented variables are preserved.
overviewPreviewDescription: Pull app and extensions environment variables.

members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

To learn how you can monitor and debug functions when errors occur, refer to [Shopify Functions error handling](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/functions/errors).

members.name: --path <value>

members.name: --verbose

name: app function schema
description:
Generates the latest [GraphQL schema](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/functions/input-output#graphql-schema) for a function in your app. Run this command from the function directory.

  This command uses the API type and version of your function, as defined in your extension TOML file, to generate the latest GraphQL schema. The schema is written to the `schema.graphql` file.
overviewPreviewDescription: Fetch the latest GraphQL schema for a function.

name: app generate extension
description:
Generates a new [app extension](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/app-extensions). For a list of app extensions that you can generate using this command, refer to [Supported extensions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/commands#supported-extensions).

  Each new app extension is created in a folder under `extensions/`. To learn more about the extensions file structure, refer to [App structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/structure) and the documentation for your extension.
overviewPreviewDescription: Generate a new app Extension.

name: app info
description:
The information returned includes the following:

  - The app and development store or Plus sandbox store that's used when you run the [dev](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/commands#dev) command. You can reset these configurations using [dev --reset](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/commands#dev).
  - The [structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/tools/cli/structure) of your app project.
  - The [access scopes](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/usage) your app has requested.
  - System information, including the package manager and version of Shopify CLI used in the project.
overviewPreviewDescription: Print basic information about your app and extensions.

  /**
   * 
   */

  /**
   * 
   */

  /**
   * The app template. Accepts one of the following:
       - <remix|none>
       - Any GitHub repo with optional branch and subpath, e.g., https://github.com/Shopify/<repository>/[subpath]#[branch]
   */
  '--template <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: app webhook trigger
description:
Triggers the delivery of a sample Admin API event topic payload to a designated address.

  You should use this command to experiment with webhooks, to initially test your webhook configuration, or for unit testing. However, to test your webhook configuration from end to end, you should always trigger webhooks by performing the related action in Shopify.

  Because most webhook deliveries use remote endpoints, you can trigger the command from any directory where you can use Shopify CLI, and send the webhook to any of the supported endpoint types. For example, you can run the command from your app's local directory, but send the webhook to a staging environment endpoint.

  To learn more about using webhooks in a Shopify app, refer to [Webhooks overview](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/webhooks).

  ### Limitations

  - Webhooks triggered using this method always have the same payload, so they can't be used to test scenarios that differ based on the payload contents.
  - Webhooks triggered using this method aren't retried when they fail.
  - Trigger requests are rate-limited using the [Partner API rate limit](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/partner#rate_limits).
  - You can't use this method to validate your API webhook subscriptions.
overviewPreviewDescription: Trigger delivery of a sample webhook topic payload to a designated address.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app webhook trigger` command:

appwebhooktrigger.name: appwebhooktrigger

members.name: --address <value>
--api-version <value>
members.description: The API Version of the webhook topic.

members.name: --client-secret <value>
members.description: Your app's client secret. This secret allows us to return the X-Shopify-Hmac-SHA256 header that lets you validate the origin of the response that you receive.

members.name: --delivery-method <value>
members.description: Method chosen to deliver the topic payload. If not passed, it's inferred from the address.

members.name: --help
members.description: This help. When you run the trigger command the CLI will prompt you for any information that isn't passed using flags.

members.name: --shared-secret <value>
members.description: Deprecated. Please use client-secret.

members.name: --topic <value>
members.description: The requested webhook topic.

name: auth logout
description: Logs you out of the Shopify account or Partner account and store.
overviewPreviewDescription: Logs you out of the Shopify account or Partner account and store.

name: commands
description: list all the commands
overviewPreviewDescription: list all the commands

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `commands` command:

commands.name: commands

members.name: --json
members.description: Format output as json.

members.name: -h, --help
members.description: Show CLI help.

members.name: --hidden
members.description: show hidden commands

members.name: --tree
members.description: show tree of commands

members.name: --columns <value>
members.description: only show provided columns (comma-separated)

members.name: --sort <value>
members.description: property to sort by (prepend '-' for descending)

members.name: --filter <value>
members.description: filter property by partial string matching, ex: name=foo

members.name: --csv
members.description: output is csv format [alias: --output=csv]

members.name: --output <value>
members.description: output in a more machine friendly format

members.name: -x, --extended
members.description: show extra columns

members.name: --no-truncate
members.description: do not truncate output to fit screen

members.name: --no-header
members.description: hide table header from output

commands.value:
export interface commands {
  /**
   * Format output as json.
   */
  '--json'?: ''

  /**
   * Show CLI help.
   */
  '-h, --help'?: ''

  /**
   * show hidden commands
   */
  '--hidden'?: ''

  /**
   * show tree of commands
   */
  '--tree'?: ''

  /**
   * only show provided columns (comma-separated)
   */
  '--columns <value>'?: string

  /**
   * property to sort by (prepend '-' for descending)
   */
  '--sort <value>'?: string

  /**
   * filter property by partial string matching, ex: name=foo
   */
  '--filter <value>'?: string

  /**
   * output is csv format [alias: --output=csv]
   */
  '--csv'?: ''

  /**
   * output in a more machine friendly format
   */
  '--output <value>'?: string

  /**
   * show extra columns
   */
  '-x, --extended'?: ''

  /**
   * do not truncate output to fit screen
   */
  '--no-truncate'?: ''

  /**
   * hide table header from output
   */
  '--no-header'?: ''
}

name: config autocorrect off
description:
Disable autocorrect. Off by default.

  When autocorrection is enabled, Shopify CLI automatically runs a corrected version of your command if a correction is available.

  When autocorrection is disabled, you need to confirm that you want to run corrections for mistyped commands.
overviewPreviewDescription: Disable autocorrect. Off by default.

name: config autocorrect on
description:
Enable autocorrect. Off by default.

  When autocorrection is enabled, Shopify CLI automatically runs a corrected version of your command if a correction is available.

  When autocorrection is disabled, you need to confirm that you want to run corrections for mistyped commands.
overviewPreviewDescription: Enable autocorrect. Off by default.

name: config autocorrect status
description:
Check whether autocorrect is enabled or disabled. On by default.

  When autocorrection is enabled, Shopify CLI automatically runs a corrected version of your command if a correction is available.

  When autocorrection is disabled, you need to confirm that you want to run corrections for mistyped commands.
overviewPreviewDescription: Check whether autocorrect is enabled or disabled. On by default.

name: help
description: Display help for <%= config.bin %>.
overviewPreviewDescription: Display help for <%= config.bin %>.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `help` command:

help.name: help

members.name: -n, --nested-commands
members.description: Include all nested commands in the output.

name: search
description: Starts a search on shopify.dev.
overviewPreviewDescription: Starts a search on shopify.dev.

name: theme check
description: Calls and runs [Theme Check](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/theme-check) to analyze your theme code for errors and to ensure that it follows theme and Liquid best practices. [Learn more about the checks that Theme Check runs.](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/theme-check/checks)
overviewPreviewDescription: Validate the theme.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme check` command:

themecheck.name: themecheck

members.name: -a, --auto-correct
members.description: Automatically fix offenses

members.name: -C, --config <value>
members.description:
Use the config provided, overriding .theme-check.yml if present  Supports all theme-check: config values, e.g., theme-check:theme-app-extension,
 theme-check:recommended, theme-check:all
 For backwards compatibility, :theme_app_extension is also supported

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: --fail-level <value>
members.description: Minimum severity for exit with error code

members.name: --init
members.description: Generate a .theme-check.yml file

members.name: --list
members.description: List enabled checks

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: -o, --output <value>
members.description: The output format to use

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: --print
members.description: Output active config to STDOUT

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

members.name: -v, --version
members.description: Print Theme Check version

themecheck.value:
export interface themecheck {
  /**
   * Automatically fix offenses
   */
  '-a, --auto-correct'?: ''

  /**
   * Use the config provided, overriding .theme-check.yml if present
      Supports all theme-check: config values, e.g., theme-check:theme-app-extension,
      theme-check:recommended, theme-check:all
      For backwards compatibility, :theme_app_extension is also supported 
   */
  '-C, --config <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Minimum severity for exit with error code
   */
  '--fail-level <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Generate a .theme-check.yml file
   */
  '--init'?: ''

  /**
   * List enabled checks
   */
  '--list'?: ''

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * The output format to use
   */
  '-o, --output <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Output active config to STDOUT
   */
  '--print'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * Print Theme Check version
   */
  '-v, --version'?: ''
}

name: theme console
description:
Starts the Shopify Liquid REPL (read-eval-print loop) tool. This tool provides an interactive terminal interface for evaluating Liquid code and exploring Liquid objects, filters, and tags using real store data.

  You can also provide context to the console using a URL, as some Liquid objects are context-specific
overviewPreviewDescription: Shopify Liquid REPL (read-eval-print loop) tool

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme console` command:

themeconsole.name: themeconsole

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: --port <value>
members.description: Local port to serve authentication service.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: --url <value>
members.description: The url to be used as context

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: theme delete
description:
Deletes a theme from your store.

  You can specify multiple themes by ID. If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme that you want to delete from the list of themes in your store.

  You're asked to confirm that you want to delete the specified themes before they are deleted. You can skip this confirmation using the `--force` flag.
overviewPreviewDescription: Delete remote themes from the connected store. This command can't be undone.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme delete` command:

themedelete.name: themedelete

members.name: -d, --development
members.description: Delete your development theme.

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: -f, --force
members.description: Skip confirmation.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: -a, --show-all
members.description: Include others development themes in theme list.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

themedelete.value:
export interface themedelete {
  /**
   * Delete your development theme.
   */
  '-d, --development'?: ''

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Skip confirmation.
   */
  '-f, --force'?: ''

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Include others development themes in theme list.
   */
  '-a, --show-all'?: ''

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: theme dev
description:
Uploads the current theme as the specified theme, or a [development theme](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#development-themes), to a store so you can preview it.

This command returns the following information:

- A link to your development theme at http://127.0.0.1:9292. This URL can hot reload local changes to CSS and sections, or refresh the entire page when a file changes, enabling you to preview changes in real time using the store's data.

  You can specify a different network interface and port using `--host` and `--port`.

- A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.

- A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with other developers.

If you already have a development theme for your current environment, then this command replaces the development theme with your local theme. You can override this using the `--theme-editor-sync` flag.

> Note: You can't preview checkout customizations using http://127.0.0.1:9292.

Development themes are deleted when you run `shopify auth logout`. If you need a preview link that can be used after you log out, then you should [share](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli/commands#share) your theme or [push](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli/commands#push) to an unpublished theme on your store.

You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).
overviewPreviewDescription: Uploads the current theme as a development theme to the connected store, then prints theme editor and preview URLs to your terminal. While running, changes will push to the store in real time.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme dev` command:

themedev.name: themedev

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: --host <value>
members.description: Set which network interface the web server listens on. The default value is 127.0.0.1.

members.name: -x, --ignore <value>
members.description: Skip hot reloading any files that match the specified pattern.

members.name: --live-reload <value>
members.description: The live reload mode switches the server behavior when a file is modified: - hot-reload Hot reloads local changes to CSS and sections (default) - full-page  Always refreshes the entire page - off        Deactivate live reload

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: -n, --nodelete
members.description: Runs the dev command without deleting local files.

members.name: --notify <value>
members.description: The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.

members.name: -o, --only <value>
members.description: Hot reload only files that match the specified pattern.

members.name: --open
members.description: Automatically launch the theme preview in your default web browser.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: --poll
members.description: Force polling to detect file changes.

members.name: --port <value>
members.description: Local port to serve theme preview from.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: --theme-editor-sync
members.description: Synchronize Theme Editor updates in the local theme files.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

themedev.value:
export interface themedev {
  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Set which network interface the web server listens on. The default value is 127.0.0.1.
   */
  '--host <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Skip hot reloading any files that match the specified pattern.
   */
  '-x, --ignore <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The live reload mode switches the server behavior when a file is modified:
- hot-reload Hot reloads local changes to CSS and sections (default)
- full-page  Always refreshes the entire page
- off        Deactivate live reload
   */
  '--live-reload <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Runs the dev command without deleting local files.
   */
  '-n, --nodelete'?: ''

  /**
   * The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.
   */
  '--notify <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Hot reload only files that match the specified pattern.
   */
  '-o, --only <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Automatically launch the theme preview in your default web browser.
   */
  '--open'?: ''

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Force polling to detect file changes.
   */
  '--poll'?: ''

  /**
   * Local port to serve theme preview from.
   */
  '--port <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Synchronize Theme Editor updates in the local theme files.
   */
  '--theme-editor-sync'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: theme info
description: Displays information about your theme environment, including your current store. Can also retrieve information about a specific theme.
overviewPreviewDescription: Displays information about your theme environment, including your current store. Can also retrieve information about a specific theme.

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */

name: theme init
description:
Clones a Git repository to your local machine to use as the starting point for building a theme.

  If no Git repository is specified, then this command creates a copy of [Dawn](https://github.com/Shopify/dawn), Shopify's example theme, with the specified name in the current folder. If no name is provided, then you're prompted to enter one.

  > Caution: If you're building a theme for the Shopify Theme Store, then you can use Dawn as a starting point. However, the theme that you submit needs to be [substantively different from Dawn](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/store/requirements#uniqueness) so that it provides added value for users. Learn about the [ways that you can use Dawn](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/dawn#ways-to-use-dawn).
overviewPreviewDescription: Clones a Git repository to use as a starting point for building a new theme.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme init` command:

themeinit.name: themeinit

members.name: -u, --clone-url <value>
members.description: The Git URL to clone from. Defaults to Shopify's example theme, Dawn: https://github.com/Shopify/dawn.git

members.name: -l, --latest
members.description: Downloads the latest release of the `clone-url`

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

export interface themelist {
  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Only list theme with the given ID.
   */

  /**
   * Output the theme list as JSON.
   */

  /**
   * Only list themes that contain the given name.
   */

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */

  /**
   * Only list themes with the given role.

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: theme open
description:
Returns links that let you preview the specified theme. The following links are returned:

  - A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.
  - A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with other developers.

  If you don't specify a theme, then you're prompted to select the theme to open from the list of the themes in your store.
overviewPreviewDescription: Opens the preview of your remote theme.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme open` command:

themeopen.name: themeopen

members.name: -d, --development
members.description: Open your development theme.

members.name: -E, --editor
members.description: Open the theme editor for the specified theme in the browser.

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: -l, --live
members.description: Open your live (published) theme.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

themeopen.value:
export interface themeopen {
  /**
   * Open your development theme.
   */
  '-d, --development'?: ''

  /**
   * Open the theme editor for the specified theme in the browser.
   */
  '-E, --editor'?: ''

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Open your live (published) theme.
   */
  '-l, --live'?: ''

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: theme package
description:
Packages your local theme files into a ZIP file that can be uploaded to Shopify.

  Only folders that match the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure) are included in the package.

  The ZIP file uses the name `theme_name-theme_version.zip`, based on parameters in your [settings_schema.json](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/architecture/config/settings-schema-json) file.
overviewPreviewDescription: Package your theme into a .zip file, ready to upload to the Online Store.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme package` command:

themepackage.name: themepackage

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: theme publish
description:
Publishes an unpublished theme from your theme library.

If no theme ID is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme that you want to publish from the list of themes in your store.

You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).

If you want to publish your local theme, then you need to run `shopify theme push` first. You're asked to confirm that you want to publish the specified theme. You can skip this confirmation using the `--force` flag.
overviewPreviewDescription: Set a remote theme as the live theme.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme publish` command:

themepublish.name: themepublish

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: -f, --force
members.description: Skip confirmation.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: theme pull
description:
Retrieves theme files from Shopify.

If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme to pull from the list of the themes in your store.
overviewPreviewDescription: Download your remote theme files locally.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme pull` command:

themepull.name: themepull

members.name: -d, --development
members.description: Pull theme files from your remote development theme.

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: -x, --ignore <value>
members.description: Skip downloading the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).

members.name: -l, --live
members.description: Pull theme files from your remote live theme.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: -n, --nodelete
members.description: Runs the pull command without deleting local files.

members.name: -o, --only <value>
members.description: Download only the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

themepull.value:
export interface themepull {
  /**
   * Pull theme files from your remote development theme.
   */
  '-d, --development'?: ''

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Skip downloading the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).
   */
  '-x, --ignore <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Pull theme files from your remote live theme.
   */
  '-l, --live'?: ''

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Runs the pull command without deleting local files.
   */
  '-n, --nodelete'?: ''

  /**
   * Download only the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).
   */
  '-o, --only <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: theme push
description:
Uploads your local theme files to Shopify, overwriting the remote version if specified.

  If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme to overwrite from the list of the themes in your store.

  You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).

  This command returns the following information:

  - A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.
  - A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with others.

  If you use the `--json` flag, then theme information is returned in JSON format, which can be used as a machine-readable input for scripts or continuous integration.

  Sample output:

  ```json
  {
    "theme": {
      "id": 108267175958,
      "name": "MyTheme",
      "role": "unpublished",
      "shop": "mystore.myshopify.com",
      "editor_url": "https://mystore.myshopify.com/admin/themes/108267175958/editor",
      "preview_url": "https://mystore.myshopify.com/?preview_theme_id=108267175958"
    }
  }
  ```
overviewPreviewDescription: Uploads your local theme files to the connected store, overwriting the remote version if specified.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme push` command:

themepush.name: themepush

members.name: -a, --allow-live
members.description: Allow push to a live theme.

members.name: -d, --development
members.description: Push theme files from your remote development theme.

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: -x, --ignore <value>
members.description: Skip downloading the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).

members.name: -j, --json
members.description: Output JSON instead of a UI.

members.name: -l, --live
members.description: Push theme files from your remote live theme.

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: -n, --nodelete
members.description: Runs the push command without deleting local files.

members.name: -o, --only <value>
members.description: Download only the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: -p, --publish
members.description: Publish as the live theme after uploading.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: -u, --unpublished
members.description: Create a new unpublished theme and push to it.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

themepush.value:
export interface themepush {
  /**
   * Allow push to a live theme.
   */
  '-a, --allow-live'?: ''

  /**
   * Push theme files from your remote development theme.
   */
  '-d, --development'?: ''

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Skip downloading the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).
   */
  '-x, --ignore <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Output JSON instead of a UI.
   */
  '-j, --json'?: ''

  /**
   * Push theme files from your remote live theme.
   */
  '-l, --live'?: ''

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Runs the push command without deleting local files.
   */
  '-n, --nodelete'?: ''

  /**
   * Download only the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).
   */
  '-o, --only <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Publish as the live theme after uploading.
   */
  '-p, --publish'?: ''

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Create a new unpublished theme and push to it.
   */
  '-u, --unpublished'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: theme rename
description:
Renames a theme in your store.

  If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme that you want to rename from the list of themes in your store.
overviewPreviewDescription: Renames an existing theme.

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

themerename.value:
export interface themerename {
  /**
   * Rename your development theme.
   */
  '-d, --development'?: ''

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Rename your remote live theme.
   */
  '-l, --live'?: ''

  /**
   * The new name for the theme.
   */
  '-n, --name <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''
}

name: theme share
description:
Uploads your theme as a new, unpublished theme in your theme library. The theme is given a randomized name.

  This command returns a [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with others.
overviewPreviewDescription: Creates a shareable, unpublished, and new theme on your theme library with a randomized name.

definitions.title: Flags
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme share` command:

themeshare.name: themeshare

members.name: -e, --environment <value>

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

name: upgrade
description: If the CLI is installed as a dependency of your app project, this command will upgrade it. Otherwise, refer to the [upgrade](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli#upgrade) documentation.
overviewPreviewDescription: Upgrade your CLI dependency.
